Author: tigerchik
Text: I'm sorry you're struggling. The weight will re-distribute. It takes about a year of staying at a healthy weight. I was diagnosed with osteoporosis at age 17 and now, 15 yrs later, my bone density is up about 10% from having stayed at a healthy weight. Vent away, and know there is hope.

Author: weegey
Text: I promise you, you are not fat at a BMI of 18.5.  I know it feels like it in comparison, but to an observer, Iâ€™m sure you look fine, probably on the thin side of healthy.  Weight redistribution takes a while, but activities like weight lifting can help (if you are able to exercise).
